Class HiringTable

  • java.lang.Object
    • HiringTable
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable
    public class HiringTable
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    This class will hold the methods to manipulate the array of applicants (HiringTable). This class includes adding, removing, getting, searching, and printing out the array of Applicants Author: Henry Nguyen Email: Henry.Nguyen@stonybrook.edu Stony Brook ID: 111484010 Recitation: 08

      • size

        public int size()
        Represents the amount of objects in the Applicant array
        Returns:
        Amount of valid applicant objects.
        Precondition: The HiringTable has been instantiated.

      • addApplicant

        public void addApplicant​(Applicant newApplicant)
                  throws FullTableException
        Adds an applicant to the end of the list
        Parameters:
        newApplicant - The new Applicant object to add to the list
        Preconditions: The Applicant object has been instantiated and the number of applicants in the list is less than the MAX_APPLICANTS
        Postcondition: New applicant is added at the end of the list.
        Throws:
        FullTableException - Indicates that there the list is full and no more applicants can be added.

      • removeApplicant

        public void removeApplicant​(java.lang.String name)
                     throws ApplicantNotFoundException
        This will remove the applicant name from the HiringTable
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the applicant to be removed
        Precondition: HiringTable is instantiated
        Postcondition: Applicant with user inputted name is removed from the list. Then applicants after the removed index is shifted down to remove any gaps.
        Throws:
        ApplicantNotFoundException - Indications that the applicant with the given name was not found

      • getApplicant

        public Applicant getApplicant​(java.lang.String name)
                       throws ApplicantNotFoundException
        This will return the Applicant toString of user inputted index.
        Parameters:
        name - User input of name to find
        Precondition: HiringTable object has been instantiated.
        Returns:
        Applicant object in a Tabular form
        Throws:
        ApplicantNotFoundException - Indications that the applicant with the given name was not found

      • refineSearch

        public static void refineSearch​(HiringTable table,
                                java.lang.String company,
                                java.lang.String skill,
                                java.lang.String college,
                                double GPA)
        i The refine search method will first check if any of the inputs are empty. If inputs are empty, filtering would not occur. If inputs are not empty, filtering would occur. For all cases, it will iterate through the array of applicants. To filter for company, it will iterate through the company array and compare it to the user inputted company filter. If its equal, applicant to be placed in a temporary array to then be filtered through. The process is repeated for skills, college and GPA. Time complexity will be O(n) because there is a limit of skills and company a applicant can have (which is 3) thus leaving O(3n).
        Parameters:
        table - The list of applicants
        company - User input company name to filter for
        skill - User input skill to filter for
        college - User input college name to filter for
        GPA - User input GPA minimum to filter for. Any GPA greater is also filtered
        Preconditions: HiringTable object has been instantiated.
        Postcondition: Display a tabular formatted table of each applicant filtered from the user inputs.

      • printApplicantTable

        public void printApplicantTable()
        This method will print All applicants in the HiringTable in a tabular form.
